article:
Mr Green, a man of fifty-two, was a gardener . He's good at _ flowers and he's one of the best gardeners in the town. Last year he _ to work for Mrs Stone, a rich fat old woman.
Mrs Stone knew nothing about gardens, but she thought she knew a lot, and she always told the old gardener to do what she said. Sometimes he listened _ her, but sometimes he didn't.
Once Mr Green got very angry  with Mrs Stone and called _ a sow . Mrs Stone _ like it and went to tell it her friend, a judge . The judge made Mr Green _ sorry to Mrs Stone.
" Does that mean I can't call the lady a sow any more?" Mr Green asked. "Yes," answered the judge. " And can I call a sow a lady, sir?" asked Mr Green. " Yes, you can if you like." Mr Green looked _ the fat woman and said, "I'm sorry, lady".
